trans-unit.source: Encrypts a cookie using <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.RSA"></xref>.
Cookies encrypted with this transform may be decrypted by any computer that shares the same RSA private key (generally associated with an X.509 certificate).
The given data is encrypted using a random AES256 key.
This key is then encrypted using RSA, and the RSA public key is sent in plain text so that when decoding the class knows which RSA key to use.
When using the <xref:System.IdentityModel.RsaEncryptionCookieTransform> with a service, if a key provided by a certificate changes the service must be restarted.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.RsaEncryptionCookieTransform"></xref> class that uses the specified key for encryption and decryption.
The key to use as the default encryption and decryption key.

Initializes the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.RsaEncryptionCookieTransform.DecryptionKeys"></xref> and <xref href="System.IdentityModel.RsaEncryptionCookieTransform.EncryptionKey"></xref> properties.
key is `null`.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.RsaEncryptionCookieTransform"></xref> class that uses the private key of the specified X.509 certificate for encryption and decryption.
The certificate whose private key is used to encrypt and decrypt.
The certificate whose private key will be used as the default encryption and decryption key.

Initializes the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.RsaEncryptionCookieTransform.DecryptionKeys"></xref> and <xref href="System.IdentityModel.RsaEncryptionCookieTransform.EncryptionKey"></xref> properties.
certificate is `null`.
certificate does not have a private key.
-or-
The private key is not RSA.
Decrypts the specified data by using the provided RSA key(s) to decrypt an AES key, which decrypts the cookie.
The encoded data
The decoded data
encoded is `null`.
encoded contains zero bytes.
The platform does not support the requested algorithm.
There are no decryption keys or none of the keys match.
Gets the keys used for decryption By default, this property returns a list that contains only the encryption key.
The keys to use for decryption.
Encodes the specified data.
The data is encrypted using the default encryption algorithm (AES-256), then the AES key is encrypted using RSA and the RSA public key is appended.
The data to encode
The encoded data
value is `null`.
value contains zero bytes.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.RsaEncryptionCookieTransform.EncryptionKey"></xref> is `null`.
Gets or sets the RSA key used for encryption
Setting this property also sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.RsaEncryptionCookieTransform.DecryptionKeys%2A> property to a collection that contains the same key as its only element.
The RSA key used for encryption.
Gets or sets the name of the hash algorithm to use.
SHA256 is the default algorithm.
This may require a minimum platform of Windows Server 2003 and .NET 3.5 SP1.
If SHA256 is not supported, set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.RsaEncryptionCookieTransform.HashName%2A> property to "SHA1".
The name of the hash algorithm to use.
The default is "SHA2566".
